intro: Silene syriaca, commonly known as Syrian campion, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region and parts of Central Asia. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring simple, alternate leaves that are often hairy. The plant produces showy, pink to purple flowers with five petals, which bloom in late spring to early summer. Silene syriaca thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it a hardy plant suitable for rock gardens and borders. Its historical use in traditional medicine and as a source of dye adds to its botanical significance.
